did.abstract: Letters by Berrien, U.S. senator and politician. Topics include the appointment of R.M. Cuyler to Annapolis; Berrien's plan to attend an Episcopal convention in 1844; subscription to the National Intelligencer; and comments on national politics in 1851. One 1852 letter invites Berrien to speak at a meeting of the N.Y.C. Friends of Millard Fillmore.
